captions.text: "Rare Species"

Finally! Now I've got you squirrel!! Oh.
It's just you. You ruined my squirrel trap.

Whatever. Now the squirrels
can sleep at night. Why don't

you try reading a book? Do
something useful for a change?

Sit still? And read? Ha!! Not in the winter!
Too busy. I've

got a to-do list a mile long
and hunting's at the top!
Aim! And fire!!

Whoa! Are butterflies
supposed to be out in winter?

Most of them leave in the fall.
But some of them stay and

sleep through the winter.
This little guy has woken up.

Nymphalis Antiopa, the Mourning Cloak! It
can withstand the cold winter temperatures,

so it's one of the first butterflies we see
in the spring, but it's still rare to find.

If I could just, eh, please stay still
for a moment! I would be highly

respected amongst entomologists
if I could capture this specimen!

Well that's all you then my friend.
I can't waste

my valuable time on some bug.
I hunt bigger game.

You're obviously not considering the level
of prestige that would accompany this find!

Just think about it. A job such as this
would require an experienced hunter.

What if you were the one who caught him?
It would make you instantly famous!

Well, I guess I'll do it. I'll just
call it practice for the big stuff.
Sure, not a problem!

Don't worry, the best hunters always
come prepared with the perfect bait.

No bug can resist fruit covered in sugar water.
One taste and he'll be stuck like glue!

Come on, land on the yummy fruit! I said land
on the yummy fruit for crying out loud!!!!
Maybe they don't get hungry during hibernation.

Maybe you're on to something,
good thinking! The Nympalis

Antiopa is probably looking
for a place to sleep!
You don't say! Heh!

I can't believe that worked!!! That was
spectacular!!!! Max Pooch, you're a genius!
You should see how I capture an elephant!!

How are we going to get him into a jar?
He'll fly out, don't you think?
Let me handle that!
Oh no you don't! Come back here!!

I've been waiting for you
to come back! You'll

never guess what happened
while you guys were out!

Can you believe it?? A butterfly in the winter!!
I found him out on my windowsill.

The poor guy was probably freezing to death.
But now he's my very best friend!
How did you capture it??! Good work!!

It took us forever! I had a pop gun, I tried
a net! We've been hunting that guy all day!!
Why were you hunting him???

That butterfly's a rare specimen, you may
never see another one in your lifetime,

once we can get him to the laboratory,
we'll be famous all over the world.

I don't care how rare he is! He's my friend! And
you don't take your friends to a laboratory!!

No it's OK Kid, it's just an old
butterfly, it's just a bug!

So what?? That doesn't give
you the right to scare

him! He's so much smaller
and weaker than you guys!
You're right. I guess he is.
It was fun for us, but it was stressful for him.

He went from sleeping in the snow
to a Buggy Dream house over night!!

Why not? It's the perfect place for him.
Only, where's

the other house? I swear
it was here earlier.
Don't worry. I'm sure it's been put to good use.
